about_the_game:
Click the mouse, train fighters, form a team, and knock down the boss!


At present, there are two types of occupations that can be cultivated, and a variety of equipment options. You must use your strengths to avoid weaknesses, and use battles to support battles until you develop a fighter that can be unique.
Form a team to challenge the BOSS to unlock more abilities!

A game that focuses on "choice"...plus a little bit of "luck"


Every step in the game is a choice!
Is it to challenge powerful enemies to get rich rewards, or to bully weak monsters to develop steadily?
Is it to increase the ability to attack and kill the monster with one blow, or to increase the defense to let the monster tickle you?
Should I buy equipment with a single attribute to specialize my abilities, or buy cost-effective composite equipment?
Should we directly attack the elite monsters and kill them on the spot, or stay away from the elite monsters and avoid the edge first?

Making the right choices can get you far, but watch out... "Random" is a big test for you!

A variety of equipment, monsters, and loot are randomly generated


The randomness may bother you, but if you can figure out the rules, you can develop stronger fighters!

Create a team

Use fighters trained in one or more games to form a crusade team,
Sometimes it is necessary to have both offense and defense, and sometimes it is necessary to formulate a strategy against the enemy,
Defeat BOSS to unlock powerful abilities and cultivate a stronger team!
detailed_description:
Click the mouse, train fighters, form a team, and knock down the boss!


At present, there are two types of occupations that can be cultivated, and a variety of equipment options. You must use your strengths to avoid weaknesses, and use battles to support battles until you develop a fighter that can be unique.
Form a team to challenge the BOSS to unlock more abilities!

A game that focuses on "choice"...plus a little bit of "luck"


Every step in the game is a choice!
Is it to challenge powerful enemies to get rich rewards, or to bully weak monsters to develop steadily?
Is it to increase the ability to attack and kill the monster with one blow, or to increase the defense to let the monster tickle you?
Should I buy equipment with a single attribute to specialize my abilities, or buy cost-effective composite equipment?
Should we directly attack the elite monsters and kill them on the spot, or stay away from the elite monsters and avoid the edge first?

Making the right choices can get you far, but watch out... "Random" is a big test for you!

The randomness may bother you, but if you can figure out the rules, you can develop stronger fighters!

Defeat BOSS to unlock powerful abilities and cultivate a stronger team!
name: Click Dungeon

subs.option_text: 方格物語-可里克地城 / Click Town - $2.99 USD

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel Core i3
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 1GB RAM, Open GL 3.3
  • Storage: 512 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: This is a turn-based strategy game, Train your fighter, carefully select equipment for him, carefully select the target of attack, and meet the coming elite monsters, Defeat monsters to get loot and improve combat power! Form a team of fighters to fight various bosses!
supported_languages:
English*, French*, Italian*, German*, Spanish - Spain*, Danish*, Russian*, Bulgarian*, Hungarian*, Turkish*, Greek*, Norwegian*, Czech*, Japanese*, Polish*, Thai*, Ukrainian*, Swedish*, Simplified Chinese*, Traditional Chinese*, Romanian*, Finnish*, Dutch*, Portuguese - Brazil*, Portuguese - Portugal*, Spanish - Latin America*, Vietnamese*, Arabic*, Korean*, Azerbaijani*, Armenian*, Igbo*, Sindhi*, Sinhala*, Quechua*, Croatian*, Icelandic*, Cherokee*, Galician*, Catalan*, Afrikaans*, Hindi*, Indonesian*, Gujarati*, Swahili*, Kyrgyz*, Kazakh*, Georgian*, Turkmen*, Tamil*, K'iche'*, Tajik*, Serbian*, Sotho*, Odia*, Welsh*, Konkani*, Bangla*, Amharic*, Nepali*, Basque*, Hebrew*, Kannada*, Estonian*, Irish*, Latvian*, Tigrinya*, Slovak*, Slovenian*, Punjabi (Gurmukhi)*, Punjabi (Shahmukhi)*, Tswana*, Maori*, Wolof*, Bosnian*, Persian*, Telugu*, Urdu*, Uzbek*, Valencian*, Belarusian*, Kinyarwanda*, Luxembourgish*, Zulu*, Xhosa*, Lithuanian*, Yoruba*, Sorani*, Uyghur*, Filipino*, Mongolian*, Scots*, Hausa*, Dari*, Albanian*, Assamese*, Tatar*, Malay*, Macedonian*, Marathi*, Malayalam*, Maltese*, Khmer*
*languages with full audio support
